data.title: Suggestion: Add option for Beautify / Format on Save
data.body: The beautifier works great as text is edited or if "editor.action.format" is initiated however for simplicity and efficiency, an option to automatically invoke the formatting on save would be a great addition.

data.title: Good First Bugs
data.body: React does something cool to bring contributors up to speed in their repo. They use [good first bugs](https://github.com/facebook/react/labels/good%20first%20bug) as a stepping stone for getting into the code. We could look into doing something similar.

data.title: High Contrast Theme: Accessibility instruction dialog (Alt+F1 on windows) isn't readable
data.body:
press Alt+F1 on windows to get the accessibility instructions dialog with the high contrast theme on, result:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13430560/d0a06cfe-dfc5-11e5-9ec2-465530257020.png)

data.title: Recongize .xhtml files
data.body: Visual Studio Code does not provide any IntelliSense, not even syntax highlighting, for .xhtml files. If IntelliSense for .html file cannot be used because of the possible conflict between the compact xhtml syntax and html syntax, I think .xhtml file should at least be treated as an XML file, which has syntax highlighting and bracket/quotes matching.

data.title: Option to turn off auto focus in file treeview
data.body: I understand some may well benefit from the tree view focusing on the file selected in the working files list, but there are many times when a file is selected in the working files list just for a quick reference. The auto focus of the tree view then becomes a hinderance to the user who now has to scroll back to the place where he was before. An option to turn this off would be great.

data.title: Incorrect highlighting when using backslashes for line continuation in TypeScript
data.body:
version 0.10.10-insider

![60ec0fb2ddde6d38feaff57a68db6528](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8966236/13427589/0288360a-dff0-11e5-8d35-7483103fa87b.jpg)

[bug demo.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/152779/bug.demo.zip)

data.title: [folding] Code Folding in larger files slows down editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In 0.10.10-insider folding more than about 3000 lines of xml slows down the editor.
Specifically moving the cursor takes seconds.

Should be reproducible with

`<root>
    <element>1</element>
  <!-- 3000 more elements -->
</root>`

Addition: If the cursor is not located in the block that gets folded, there is no lag.

data.title: Working files picker not discoverable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Working files picker is hardly discoverable, we should market this feature better
1. It is completely disconnected from the working files view, which might make sense since all the functionality is there already. But maybe only to add it there so the users learn that working files can be accessed via quick open also. Not sure if context menu action is a good choice - just a food for thought
2. It should be in the view menu, after command palette, or in the goto menu after goto file

data.title: [folding] Allow to fold a specific level
data.body:
It should be possible to fold all sections in the current file that have a specific indentation level.
- it should be possible to right click on a code folding icon and select _(Un)Fold all on this level_
- it should be possible to trigger this action from command palette or shortcut to fold all on the level of the section the cursor currently is in.

data.title: showInputBox should allow to change contents based on input

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
`vscode.window.showInputBox()` lets me accept user input through the command palette, but it is a two step process.  I have to first execute a command and then i have to show the input box.  Ideally, I should be able to prompt and accept input in one command, much in the way the git branch prompt does:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13425898/37f9eae0-dfaa-11e5-920f-07caf0807a4d.png)

here i'm prompted with "git checkout", if i have a set of branches they are shown in the list, and I can free form type in any text in order to create a new branch.  

As an extension author I would love to be able to have a similar model. For example, let's say I want to have a list of tasks and each task can take a parameter.  

myextension create thing1
myextension create thing2

in this case i don't want to select "myextension create thing1" and then have an input box.  What i want is to be able to say "myextension thing1 thing1's description".  This is also similar to the extension install experience where i can say `ext install myextension` where `myextension` is free form text.

data.title: Integrate node-debug in nls tooling
Add Ctrl+Right behavior option
data.body:
Ctrl+Right behaves like sublime, it goes to the end of the current word.  

VS (and other Windows editors such as notepad, word) goes to the beginning of the next word.

To satisfy both camps we should add an editor option to control this behavior.

data.title: Suggestion: Add theme description to Preferences | Color Theme list

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When installing a theme you see the description of the theme/extension in the command palette:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13422291/203edd90-df94-11e5-84e3-bf258dcfa280.png)

But once installed you no longer see the description when changing themes: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13422282/11b89f72-df94-11e5-90c8-1004c23ba877.png)

Suggestion is to also show description.

data.title: Files are saved in UTF-8 without BOM
data.body: How to save files in UTF-8 with BOM?

Then I tried to close the file by middle clicking the file name up the top which entered the cursor scroll mode, allowing me to scroll the editor down. data.title: Multiple Cursors Copy & Paste Bug, Bottom to Top selection
data.body:
When you select multiple lines from bottom to top, copy and paste the lines are pasted in reverse order.  

[Example Youtube Video](https://youtu.be/KvqucweG7B8)

data.title: Opening folder in second window of VSCode opens in first window of VSCode in error

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
1. Open VSCode and open a folder for project A
2. Go to File -> New Window
3. In the new window Open the same folder for project A. This will cause nothing to happen as it is still open in the first VSCode window
4. In the new window, open a folder for project B.

Expected: it to open in the new VSCode window
Actual: opens in the first VSCode window, replacing project A as the open folder.

data.title: [0.10.10-insiders] Code folding for #region/#endregion

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It seems that `#region`/`#endregion` syntax in both PowerShell and C# isn't foldable in the 0.10.10-insiders release:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79405/13413795/3954aa5e-df02-11e5-8018-d1b24f9d0a8e.png)

It seems that `#if`/`#endif` work fine though. What should our syntax definition files need to make these regions fold correctly?

data.title: Suggestion: Allow customizing the css of the workbench
data.body:
In Atom it's possible to edit the css of the editor by going to "File > Open Your Stylesheet" and overriding the css of the editor. Since vscode is also based on HTML I imagine it wouldn't be too difficult to implement this feature in vscode as well. It would be very convenient to be able to customize the UI with css and possibly in other ways too.

I can see this feature being useful both in extensions and for the user to easily customize his or her experience. The thing I would like to do with it is move the debug widget to the side, because I find that it is placed in a very inconvenient location by default.

data.title: Folder explorer is faded for some reason
Add Case sensitivity to editor.action.addSelectionToNextFindMatch
Simplify --goto's usage

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently `--goto` uses the following form:

``` sh
code file.ext:10:2 --goto # opens "file.ext" at 10th line, 2nd column
code file.ext:10:2 -g     # opens "file.ext" at 10th line, 2nd column

code file.ext:10:2        # opens the file "file.ext:10:2"
```

This is a little difficult to explain this in the usage and is a little different to how CLI args are handled on unix-like systems. I propose this instead:

``` sh
code file.ext -g 10:2     # opens "file.ext" at 10th line, 2nd column
code file.ext --goto=10:2 # opens "file.ext" at 10th line, 2nd column
```

This follows the `-g <value>`, `--goto=<value>` standard and also allows `-g/--goto` to be documented in isolation of the path arg.

This also brings it in line with how the `--locale` arg seems to work currently.

data.title: Request to add "Close All Files Above / Below" in Working Files list
data.body: Many modern editors that have tabs have options like "Close all to the right / left" or "Close all but this..." so you can close multiple files at once. The same can be added to the working files list. Right-click on a file and we should see options like "Close all files above", "Close all files below", and "Close all files but this one". I often organize files in tabs (or in the Working files list in the case of VS Code) according to function within the app I am working on. For instance, I may have a user view, user controller and user model open followed by login view, login controller and login model files. If I no longer need to refer to the login files, I could simply right-click the user model and select "Close all files below" rather than closing each login related file individually. I do this frequently throughout the day regardless of the project I am working on and I am sure this feature would be beneficial to others as well as it is an easy way to quickly clean up the working files list if you have many open.

data.title: Add the command line arguments mentioned in the docs to CLI's usage
data.body: https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/codebasics#_additional-command-line-arguments

data.title: Suggestion: git branch list sorted by most recent commit

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Currently it appears that the git branch list is sorted alphabetically. It would be nice if I could get it to sort by most recent commit in the branch, ie, date descending, so that active branches are nearer to the top of the list & stale branches are nearer to the bottom of the list.

data.title: Improve git partial staging discoverability

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: In `Git GUI`, you can right click a tracked & changed file and stage just the selected lines, or just the current hunk. It's the UI version of `git add -p` This is extremely useful when splitting up lots of code changes in to several commits. It would be nice to have this partial stage functionality in this app.

data.title: Suggestion: collapse unchanged regions in diff
data.body: When viewing a diff (2 pane or inline) it would be useful to collapse the unchanged lines. This helps focus in on just the changes, especially when the changes are few an spread out.

data.title: Add help/usage flags for CLI code command
data.body:
vscode supports a few CLI arguments but there's no --help, -h, or even a /? flag that prints help/usage information to look them up from command line.

List of additional CLI arguments supported according to docs:
https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/codebasics#_additional-command-line-arguments

On OSX calling `code --help`, `code -h`, or even `code /?` just opens the editor and doesn't print any helpful information.

data.title: Error updating on Windows

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I am getting an error trying to update to the new 0.10.10 release on Windows.

I received the notification, clicked on "update and restart" and it showed this error:

![errorupdatevscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/199648/13404671/1877ddec-df1b-11e5-8ab1-46d7ecdd470f.png)

Pressing "start again" shows the same error, cancel roll backs the install.
